verses.verse: Let all slaves, who are under a yoke, consider their own masters worthy of full honor, so that the name of God and his doctrine be not spoken evil of.

Now those, who have believing masters, must not despise them, because they are brothers, but instead, they must obey them, because they are faithful and worthy of love, partakers of the gospel benefits. Teach and insist on these things.
If any man teaches otherwise and doesn't consent with the wholesome sayings of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching on godliness,
he is proud, knowing nothing, and having a sick interest in questioning and trifles, from which comes envy, discord, abusive verbal attacks, [and] evil surmisings,
the useless line of work from men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, who suppose that financial gain is godliness. Withdraw yourself from this kind.
But godliness with contentment is great gain.
We brought nothing into this world, [and it is] certain we can carry nothing out.
Having food and clothing, let us be content with these.
Those who determine to be rich fall into temptation, a trap, and into many foolish and harmful cravings, which drown men in destruction and eternal ruin.
For the love of money is the root of all evil, which some, longing for, strayed from the faith and pierced themselves with many sorrows.
But you, O man of God, run away from these things and follow righteousness, godliness, faith, love, constancy, [and] meekness.
Give vigorous effort in the good battle of faith, powerfully grip eternal life, to which you were invited and have made known openly [your] good confession [of faith] before many witnesses.

I command you in the sight of God, who gives life to everything, and in the sight of Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession, 1Ti 6:14 that you obey this commandment spotlessly and blamelessly, until the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ,
who will show at his own time who is the blessed and only authority, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
who alone has immortality, living in the light, which no one can approach, whom no one has seen or can see, to whom be honor and everlasting power. Amen.
Command those, who are rich in this present world, that they be not arrogant or trust in undependable riches, but [to trust] in the living God who richly gives us everything to enjoy.
[Command] that they do good, be rich in good works, ready to donate, willing to share,
storing for themselves a good foundation for the time to come, that they may take hold of eternal life.
O Timothy, carefully keep safe what was committed to your trust, avoiding ungodly and fruitless babblings and oppositions from, what is falsely called, science,
which some claiming expertise have turned away from the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.
